comment: As someone who struggles in math, he has been the best math professor I've had! Everything is on ALEKS and while the class is tough at times, he definitely tries to help! You teach yourself most of the material but its doable if you put in the work. Consists of 20 hw, 4 exams, and a quiz! Will miss this course and he's very sweet as well!

Professor VanBrackle is an extremely easy professor for online classes. The entire class was online, not lockdown browser, and open from day 1. Unlimited attempts on homework. Definitely would take again if I had to take another math course.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Bad

I used to hate statistics, but this professor made it very easy to understand. He has organized the class very well. He always reminds the class when things are due. He is one of the best online classes you can take. I am sure that in person he must be great too. The class is tough at times, but he helps you make it easy and understand it.

I loved professor Vanbrackle. He is so nice, and always ready to help you. This course is organized very well, and he gives out weekly reminders with a great sense of humor on the side. He was so helpful with a few applications I asked for his help with, and is extremely knowledgeable. As a hater of math, he will make you hate it a little less.

Everything is on ALEKS, he does not teach at all so be prepared to basically teach yourself everything. The class was not hard at all but it definitely is a preferred taste. He lets you know what chapters are going to be on each test and each test is exactly like the homework and everything is due when the final is due so you have time.

The professor himself is in retirement and teaches the class online from out of the city. The whole class was on ALEKS. There were 20 assignments, 3 tests, and 1 cumulative final. The hw is almost the same as the tests. All the homework is due at the end of the semester, only tests have due dates. You could finish the whole class in a month or two.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: His class online was pretty good for the most part. expect to basically teach yourself the criteria using example problems (which are very helpful), given that everything is on ALEKS. He responds to emails a little later than I would like, but his responses are very helpful and nice professor. If i wasn't a bad test taker would have higher grade.

I did not enjoy this because your whole class is ALEKS, which wasnt my cup of tea. The textbook did not help and you're forced to used the kind of garbage explanations that they give for individual problems and try to figure it out yourself. If you can figure out the homework tests are easy but good luck if you cant.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Test heavy

comment: Very good teacher and wasnt strict on due dates besides the dates for the tests. The homework isnt due until the end of the semester and you get an unlimited amount of times to pass them. Lastly, as long as you complete the work on connect math youre good.

I took this class online, and it's nothing to write home about. He has all the homework unlocked, and they are due at the very last day. The only due dates are the 3 tests. He sends out emails very occasionally. It's easy material and a very uneventful class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Good bit of homework, easy at first but then you get into the more intricate stuff. Would not be hard at all if you take the time to teach yourself because Prof puts all assignments up and that's the extent of his efforts. Besides due date reminder emails. Not bad if you're willing to make the effort and own a Ti-84, which I do not... oops
Fantastic teacher, very caring.

Dr. VanBrackle was very helpful. I struggled with this class, math is not my strength and he was more than willing to take extra time to help me grasp concepts. There were a few aspects about connect math that I didn't like, but these were out of his control. He went the extra mile after the covid-19 shook everything up. He was great!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Amazing professor, cares about his students. I had an 89 in the class, but I worked really hard during the semester and he bumped my grade to an A. Responds quickly to emails and good at explaining things I didn't understand from Connect Math. 100% would take him again.

One of the best stat professors I have ever had at KSU. I love his stories, the way he teachers, and his attitude towards stats. He wants to be sure every passes but also understands the material. I recommend him entirely!

GREAT professor! Three graded homeworks, three tests, and one final. I normally do not do well with only a couple grades, but I paid attention and studied a good amount, but not too hard, and I pulled out a low A. He is entertaining and explains everything very clearly. I would definitely take him again!
Best stats professor I've ever had!!! He explained everything well and answered any questions I had to the fullest. Very nice guy and has funny stories, take him if at all possible!!!
Great Professor

Tends to go off tangents, but he's always funny to listen to. Very knowledgeable about material, deep statistical stuff. we just had homework assignment, test and capstone project. He does talk too fast, but you get used to it. Recommend his class to anyone.

This is the undergrad-level course that corresponds with 8120.  As usual, Dr. VB is brilliant and entertaining.  The material is fairly complicated if you look into the theory, but you'll do fine if you just stick to running and interpreting the data.  I'm a stat minor, and this was the most interesting stats course I've taken so far.

Amazing teacher. Had him for summer semester and loved his class.Tests are a bit hard but if you have a question he helps you.Do the homework and you will do fine on the test.By far the most helpful teacher I had at KSU. I highly recommend him if you are looking for an A. I never had Biostats and walked away with an A. Take him if you can.

Amazing teacher. Had him for summer semester and loved his class.Tests are a bit hard but if you have a question he helps you.Do the homework and you will do fine on the test.By far the most helpful teacher I had at KSU. I highly recommend him if you are looking for an A. I never had Biostats and walked away with an A. Take him if you can.

Dr. VanBrackle loves statistics and science, and makes every effort to ensure everyone understands the topic at hand. He tends to go off on tangents, but they are always pertinent to the topic in the long run. Rarely uses the text, and notes are very concise and to the point (what he writes is what you need to know). Pay attention, you'll do great!
Good instructor - sense of humor - tries to make this class fun and easy to comprehend. Come to class, do work, you will be fine.

Dr VanBrackle is an excellent teacher. I was so afraid of this class. Took it the previous summer with DeMaio and feared another arrogant professor who only knew one way to explain something. VanBrackle is a professional statistician and knows the topic front to back. He also knows how to teach and is truly invested in his students learning.

He was a very nice guy but his test were harder than he said, and if you fail one your doomed because there is no way to get your grade back up unless you pass with A's on the next two. Even his take home tests were hard!

Very nice guy. Class started very easy, but its gotten really hard. I now need like a 97 or higher on the final to get an A, wish me luck... Yeah, and the final coumts so much that I need an 80 or higher just not to get a C

I love this teacher so much I requested him as my advisor.  He's very friendly and very hyper.  Has great examples in class.  He uses the TI83 a lot and isn't to big on formulas.  His class is perfect for the people that aren't good at math.  Tests are easy.

He has some kind of super hyper personality, like he is really excited about everything he says.  It's like that guy on the infomercial with question amrks on his suit, toned down one notch.  Still, an awesome professor.  Easy.

Awesome teacher, makes statistics interesting and fun to learn about.  No attendance policy, but try not to miss class or you will miss a concept and be left behind.  Talks very quick and likes very organized work.  Awesome teacher.
